questions.question_text: An engineer is designing a point-to-multipoint mesh network. Which two AP configurations must be completed for a site survey? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:

B and E are the right answers. as we are talking about design not configuration

Selected Answer: BE
Selected answers are correct. His is not for configuring mesh but surveying

Selected Answer: A
SNR isn't mentioned here. All other criteria meet answer A

Selected Answer: A
This means Location also: APs staggered throughout a facility, with several of them placed on the exterior walls

Selected Answer: C
SNR for voice is 25 dB. Only C doesn't have voice as answear.

choices.A: location services, VoIP, data, and video
choices.C: location-based services, BYOD preparation, and HD video streaming
choices.B: streaming video with VoIP, data, and HD resolution
choices.D: voice, data clients, and video on demand

questions.question_text: The wireless survey report shows APs staggered throughout a facility, with several of them placed on the exterior walls. Other APs are located at building corners and major turns in the structure layout. Assuming that all survey locations are optimized with a minimum of -67 RSSI at cell edges with 20% overlapping cells, for which purpose is this survey model used?
An engineer must perform a predictive design for a wireless network. The customer has devices that can tolerate at most 100 ms of delay when roaming. Which design criteria must be used?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct

questions.question_text: A wireless engineer must assess constraints for a future WLAN deployment for a site that consists of office cubicles. Which signal propagation attenuation result is associated with this environment?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The BSS transition will help customer to move to the next AP in there roaming process. The BSS is enable on SSID and not on radio.

Selected Answer: D
My previous answer is wrong, D is the correct answer.

Selected Answer: D
Choose Configuration > Wireless > Advanced.
Step 2 On the Advanced page, click the relevant band's tab: either 5 GHz Band or 2.4 GHz Band.

Game over
A is the right choice, 802.11V or BSS Transition should apply on the radio level, and Optimized roaming should apply on SSID level

Selected Answer: A
BSS Transition (802.11v): This feature helps in steering the client to a better AP by providing information about the best candidate APs for roaming. Enabling BSS transition ensures that clients are informed about other APs they can move to, improving the roaming decisions made by the client devices.
 Optimized Roaming: This feature on the SSID level ensures that the clients are prompted to roam to a better AP when their signal strength falls below the configured RSSI threshold.

comments.content: Actually, you're right. Answer is D.

questions.question_text: An engineer configured the optimized client roaming on Cisco WLC with an RSSI threshold of 72dBm. Clients report frequent disconnections. What must be configured for the AP to guide the client to a better AP?

choices.A: Enable BSS transition at the radio level and optimized roaming on the SSID.
choices.D: Enable BSS transition on the SSID and optimized roaming at the radio level.
choices.B: Disable coverage hole detection on the SSID and enable BSS transition on the SSID.
choices.C: Disable optimized roaming and enable 802.11v support on the SSID.
